utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, couldn’t help but notice none of you RSVP’d to my murder mystery dinner party.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. We were meaning to do that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, you weren’t because it was a week ago and nobody came. So, if you want to solve the mystery of who stabbed Koothrappali in the back with the weapon of indifference, it was all of you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t think thatqualifies as a mystery, we all knew what we were doing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We’re sorry, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe we can do it next week.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, we’re not that sorry.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t worry, I can take a hint. No more murder mystery parties.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hallelujah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Because I’ve got something even better planned.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just hear me out. I’m going to make you guys a scavenger hunt like they have at M.I.T.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I loved those. I did them every year there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We did them at Princeton, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s cute. Like it’s a real college.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s amusing, I was going to say that about M.I.T., but it works for Princeton, too.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Scavenger hunts at Harvard were really tough. I always got stuck on the first challenge, trying to find someone to be on a team with me. I guess that story’s more sad than funny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I love scavenger hunts. My friends and I had them all the time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, these are a little different. There’s a tradition at elite universities…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And Princeton.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A tradition of hunts full of puzzles that rely on logic and obscure knowledge, science.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, in ours we would just run around town looking for a store that would sell us beer.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, uh, who’s in?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think it sounds fun.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Various
utterance.content: I’m in, let’s do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Are we really doing this or are we tricking Koothrappali again like with the dinner party?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s all this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, everything I could possibly need to win the scavenger hunt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You really think he’s gonna send us to a bowling alley?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if he does, do you know how filthy those rental balls are? They might as well stand on the corner and give away free rectal exams.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, everybody. Who’s ready for a scavenger hunt? Somewhere in the city of Pasadena, I’ve hidden a golden coin. You will be faced with a total of ten puzzles. Each p… each, each puzzle will lead you to the location of the next, the last of which will lead you to the coin. The first team that finds it wins.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He is a born showman.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Any questions?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, to be fair, do people who went to Princeton get a head start?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not funny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, Oh, it actually is if you get the joke. It’s based on the premise that Princeton isn’t a very good school.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ha-ha.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, see? Now he gets it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, guys, go ahead and divide yourselves into teams of two.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Should we just do couples?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Couples sounds great. Or we could mix things up. Maybe pick names out of a hat. Whatever.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Why don’t you just admit you don’t want to be on a team with me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just said, couples sound great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm, yeah, you don’t think I’m smart enough. You think I’m gonna be a liability. Even though I totally just used the word liability correctly in a sentence. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, let’s, let’s do couples. I want to.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no. Let’s mix things up. I choose Sheldon, and we’re gonna kick your ass!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? The only time I’m ever picked first for a team and I’m stuck with the liability?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Stop that. Penny is not a liability.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you. Do you want to be on my team?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe we pick names out of a hat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, hurry up and close the door so they can’t hear us. Would you stop pouting? So, you picked my name. Get over it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, and do you know what the odds are I’d pick your name?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not hard, one in five. Now you know why I’m pouting.

utterance.speaker: Raj (over walkie-talkie)
utterance.content: All right, teams. Get ready to open your first puzzle. Go. Do you see what I did? The first puzzle is a puzzle. Oh, my God, how adorable is that? I wish I had a friend like me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing? You have to start with the edges.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, there’s no right way, Sheldon. I already found a few pieces that fit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, take them apart and start with the edges. And stop wasting time.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, you’re really good at puzzles.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I did them all the time as a kid. As my mom used to say, when you’re doing a puzzle, it’s like having a thousand friends. She was full of fun lies like that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If it makes you feel any better, my mom’s just full of pound cake.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry you got stuck with me. I bet you wanted to be with Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Have you ever played a game with Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Have you ever gone into a steel cage with a wolverine?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Faster, faster, faster! Do you not know that word? It means more fast!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Stop yelling at me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, you’ll know when I’m yelling at you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, it’s the comic book store. All right, come on, that’s where we have to go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But we haven’t finished the puzzle.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But, it, it doesn’t matter. We know the answer, come on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You think you know the answer. But it could be a trick. What if when the puzzle’s complete, there’s a sign in the window that says go to the train store?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, it’s not gonna say that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I hope you’re wrong. I really want to go to the train store.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s the comic book store. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, numb nuts, it’s the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s the comic book store, it’s the comic book store, it’s the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do you think Penny’s mad at me?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because you’re in the right lane behind a bus and you won’t go around it? I’m sure she finds it charming.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, because I didn’t want her on my team.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m starting to think she dodged a bullet. The slowest bullet in the world.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Geez, I never realized you were so competitive.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. Its, it’s probably because I grew up with five brothers and sisters so I had to fight for every… Oh, my God, you did not just slow down for a bird, you know they fly, right?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think this is the first time we’ve ever actually been alone together.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Huh, I guess you’re right. Wonder why that is?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, off the top of my head, I’d say we don’t have a lot in common except for the people we’re involved with. Plus, when we first met, Penny warned me never to get into a car alone with you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. You know, I bet you and I have more in common than we think.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Such as?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Tell me some things you like.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, let’s see. I like harps, Little House on the Prairie, medieval poetry, medieval literature…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, how about some music?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Great. Sheldon never lets me listen to music in the car. He doesn’t want to be mistaken for a gang member.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Find something you like.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Beatles, boring. Eminem, scary. Weird Al? How old are you? Neil Diamond?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I love Neil Diamond.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I love Neil Diamond.

utterance.speaker: Both
utterance.content: Sweet Caroline, bum-ba-da, good times never seemed so good, so good, so good, so good. I’ve been inclined…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, hey, thanks for letting me use the comic book store as part of the scavenger hunt.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, my pleasure. Always happy to help out with fun things that I wasn’t invited to be a part of.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, congratulations. You’re the first team to arrive.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, it’s not a ruse to make fun of me. It’s a real game and I’m winning it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Your next puzzle is a riddle. And who better to give it to you than The Riddler?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go! How am I faster than you? I’m in heels and I stopped to take a phone call.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I have asthma. Back off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Riddle me this. Arrah, Arrah, and gather round, the work of this hero is legion-bound. He multiplies N by the number of He, and in this room the thing you’ll see.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good riddle, huh?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah. So when you guys plan fun activities, does my name even come up, or…?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I invited you to my murder mystery party.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No, you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, we’re the last ones here, hurry up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is a marathon, not a sprint.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: People run in a marathon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not with a bowling ball on their back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Penny, I just wanted to say good luck, and I hope there’s no hard feelings.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, Romeo. Repair your relationship on your own time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Relax, it’s a hard puzzle. It’s gonna take a while to solve.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Riddle me this…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Princeton, look at that, Team Community College Night School is in the lead.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought we were the Lightning Sharks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, you know what this could mean .

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, oh, that’s good. Then this would be

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: To the Neil Mobile.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I knew it, we’re gonna lose.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, I got it. I got it/

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Congratulations, you got it last.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re really mean, you know that?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So no one’s gonna buy anything.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aha. Okay, let’s see. To continue on your quest, leave no stone unturned. Ooh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The next clue must be hidden under one of these rocks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Sheldon, I, I’ve got to ask, how did you figure out that it was the geology lab?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, simple, the ‘arrah, ‘arrah in the riddle mean Jan Arrah, a member of the Legion of Superheroes, known as Element Lad. And then the word He, it wasn’t the masculine pronoun, but rather H e, the abbreviation for helium. See where I’m going with this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nice try. Now, Element Lad’s ability is the power to transmute chemical elements. Helium has an atomic number of two. If you multiply that by the atomic number of N, nitrogen, you get 14, which is the atomic number of? I’m just funnin’ you, silicon. And that is the most common element in the Earth’s surface. So that narrowed it down to the geology lab or the chemistry lab.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. I can drink a beer underwater.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I’m sure your parents are proud. Now, finally, the line in this room the thing you’ll see was an obvious reference to Fantastic Four member The Thing, who’s made entirely of…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shut up. I solved it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Those are map coordinates. Got ’em. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, wait. Don’t you want to know how I figured it out?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No one likes a know-it-all, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: On the boats and on the planes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: They’re coming to America.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Never looking back again.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: They’re coming to America… ♪

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, I’m okay with you driving my car. I’m not okay with you flying my car.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t sweat it, my dad’s a cop. He can fix things.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Like death?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (out of the window)
utterance.content: Your kid may be an honour student but you’re a moron.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny’s not answering my texts.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who cares? Focus on the game.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This stupid game is why she’s mad in the first place. I’m telling her I’m quitting.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. Quitting would be the worst thing for your relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because it would make you seem like something she already thinks you are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What does she think I am?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How do I put this? She’s been known to call you a name that usually applies to a lady part. Or a cat. Or a willow.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can’t believe she would say that about me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If you’re gonna cry about it there’s tissues in my purse. Unless you got some in yours. Big willow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They’re coming to America, They’re coming to America.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Today!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Today!

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: Today! Today!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, another 30 feet.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Oh, it’s a bowling alley.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Yes. My brain is better than everybody’s.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Love on the rocks.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ain’t no big surprise.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just pour me a drink.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And I’ll tell you some lies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Call me a lady part. We’ll see about that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can you reach the clue?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Almost.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hurry, Sheldon and Penny were right behind us in the bowling alley.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Great, climb back up. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, Penny might be onto something.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To the planetarium.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To the tar pits.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: There’s a Neil Diamond concert next month.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Three bags, no one’s opened ’em. we’re the first ones here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s dirty laundry. You’re up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Why me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because you’ve been training for this your whole life. You live in a pile of dirty laundry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: They’re here first. This is because you made me slow down for that blind guy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, the clue must be in the bag.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The clue must be in the bag.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s just a bunch of pants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s just a bunch of pants.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I’m surprised you want to copy my answers since I’m not even smart enough to be on your team.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, why would you want to be on someone’s team who you like to call a, I can’t even say it in front of Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know exactly what I’m talking about.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, she doesn’t. I just made that up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because you were about to quit like a big, Sheldon, cover your ears.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not a child. I know the word ninny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you should have quit ’cause I’m still gonna beat your ass.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wish I had a man like her on my team.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I am every bit as much of a man as Penny. Now, let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, it’s not all pants, there’s one shirt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, that’s my shirt.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This one is, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, that’s not mine. It has a big spot on it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But wait. So does this one.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Maybe the spot’s the clue.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon’s spot. The coin is in your spot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s clever.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: Hurry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Be there in a minute. I just have to pre-soak these.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Stop her, Leonard, stop her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, where the hell’s the coin?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wasn’t the answer Sheldon’s spot?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yes, Leonard. Yes, it was.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Then where’s the coin?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes, exactly. Where is the coin? Why don’t you look in your pockets? I slipped them in there earlier today.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t you see? When we’re all having fun together, we’re already winners. Oh, look. See? Even I’m a winner.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you kidding me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That is the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You suck so hard.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I thought… Come on, I didn’t want anyone to feel bad at the end of the game. And some of those puzzles were really hard and I didn’t know who was gonna get Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Run.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, okay, that-that came out wrong, but you have to admit, you all had a wonderful time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Run to India.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I just wanted to do something beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (entering)
utterance.content: Hey, look. I won.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, she got the way to move me, Cherry,

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She got the way to groove me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cherry, baby

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She got the way to move me, honey.

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: She got the way to groove me. She got the way to move me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cherry

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: She got the way to groove me, yeah!
